article:
Events and trends
* c. 1655 BCâTan-Uli, the ruler of the Elamite Empire, dies.
* c. 1650 BCâGreeks start to live in Mycenae.
* c. 1650 BCâMiddle Kingdom ends in Ancient Egypt (other date is 1674 BC).
* c. 1650 BCâSecond Intermediate Period starts in Ancient Egypt (other date
  is 1674 BC).
* c. 1650 BC â "Flotilla" fresco, from Room 5 of West House, Akrotiri
  (Santorini), Thera, is made. Second Palace period. It is now kept in National
  Archaeological Museum, Athens.
* EgyptâStart of Seventeenth Dynasty.
* c. 1650 BCâBetween Rapperswil and Hurden, on the so-called Seedamm, a first
  wooden bridge was constructed on Lake ZÃ¼rich in Switzerland
* c. 1650 BCâThe last Woolly mammoths become extinct on Wrangel Island.
* c. 1650 BCâThe Rhind Mathematical Papyrus is produced. Jan Gullberg, C13
  Trigonometry, Maths from Birth of Numbers, W. W. Norton in 1997 (ISBN
  039304002X )
* c. 1650 BCâBeginning of construction of 900-acre Poverty Point settlement
  earthworks (now northern Louisiana) by NA hunter-gatherers.
